data.name: James Williamson

tasks: Lead of assembly and process engineer
Coordination of production processes
Responsibility for on-time delivery and further development of processes
Technical documentation
Technical and disciplinary supervisor of production
Scheduling and coordination of personnel and material deployment
Make-or-buy decisions for soft machining (turning, milling)
Technical contact person for suppliers
Preparation and development of documents for production
Planning and tendering of production orders
Improvement of production processes
Support in the development of internal company standards and regulations
Technical support of customers including customer consulting
Participation in trade fairs and speaker at training courses
Successful management of several internal customer-related projects
Examination of customer inquiries for feasibility
Analyses of work processes and their cost-technical status for management
Preparation of preliminary and final calculations, determination of working times using BDE
Safety officer for production (from 2021)
Central contact person for trainees and external training companies (from 2017)

work_experience.company_name: MSB Maschinen- und Stahlbau GmbH & Co. KG
tasks: Material disposition via stock lists and checking steel profiles in the workshop
Processing drawings and triggering orders for purchased parts
Checking order confirmations for purchased parts
Tracking deadlines via the production status of individual orders
Creation of cutting templates for conveyor technology orders
Coordination between design and production
Input and maintenance of individual sections of the QMS
Maintenance of drawing indexes
Support of management through organizational tasks in the workshop and reporting to management
Production planning
Assembly of steel constructions, railings, stairs and stage systems

certifications: State-certified Technician exam in Mechanical Engineering, specializing in Systems and Automation Technology. Grade: Good.

other_qualification: REFA qualifications in work organization, statistics, quality methods, quality management, and cost accounting
